Returns: This value will never be null.
setSettingsText(java.lang.CharSequence).Description: Provides text that will appear as a link to your application's settings. This text does not appear within notification @B_android#app#Notification#Style_E@ but may appear when the user uses an affordance to learn more about the notification. Additionally, this text will not appear unless you provide a valid link target by handling @B_android#app#Notification#INTENT_CATEGORY_NOTIFICATION_PREFERENCES_E@. This text is meant to be concise description about what the user can customize when they click on this link. The recommended maximum length is 40 characters.

getExtras().Description: Get the current metadata Bundle used by this notification Builder. The returned Bundle is shared with this Builder. The current contents of this Bundle are copied into the Notification each time @B_android#app#Notification#Builder#build_E@ is called.

Returns: This value will never be null.

setDefaults(int).Description: use @B_android#app#NotificationChannel#enableVibration_E@ and @B_android#app#NotificationChannel#enableLights_E@ and @B_android#app#NotificationChannel#setSound_E@ instead. Set which notification properties will be inherited from system defaults. The value should be one or more of the following fields combined with bitwise-or: @B_android#app#Notification#DEFAULT_SOUND_E@, @B_android#app#Notification#DEFAULT_VIBRATE_E@, @B_android#app#Notification#DEFAULT_LIGHTS_E@. For all default values, use @B_android#app#Notification#DEFAULT_ALL_E@.
setDefaults(int).history: Added in API level 11 Deprecated in API level 26

setUsesChronometer(boolean).Description: Show the @B_android#app#Notification#when_E@ field as a stopwatch. Instead of presenting when as a timestamp, the notification will show an automatically updating display of the minutes and seconds since when. Useful when showing an elapsed time (like an ongoing phone call). The counter can also be set to count down to when when using @B_android#app#Notification#Builder#setChronometerCountDown_E@.

Returns: This value will never be null.
setRemoteInputHistory(java.lang.CharSequ.Description: Set the remote input history. This should be set to the most recent inputs that have been sent through a @B_android#app#RemoteInput_E@ of this Notification and cleared once the it is no longer relevant (e.g. for chat notifications once the other party has responded). The most recent input must be stored at the 0 index, the second most recent at the 1 index, etc. Note that the system will limit both how far back the inputs will be shown and how much of each individual input is shown. Note: The reply text will only be shown on notifications that have least one action with a RemoteInput.

Returns: This value will never be null.
setCustomContentView(android.widget.Remo.Description: Supply custom RemoteViews to use instead of the platform template. This will override the layout that would otherwise be constructed by this Builder object.

setGroupAlertBehavior(int).Description: Sets the group alert behavior for this notification. Use this method to mute this notification if alerts for this notification's group should be handled by a different notification. This is only applicable for notifications that belong to a @B_android#app#Notification#Builder#setGroup_E@. This must be called on all notifications you want to mute. For example, if you want only the summary of your group to make noise, all children in the group should have the group alert behavior @B_android#app#Notification#GROUP_ALERT_SUMMARY_E@. The default value is @B_android#app#Notification#GROUP_ALERT_ALL_E@.

Parameters: String: A URI for the person.
addPerson(java.lang.String).Description: use @B_android#app#Notification#Builder#addPerson_E@ Add a person that is relevant to this notification. Depending on user preferences, this annotation may allow the notification to pass through interruption filters, if this notification is of category @B_android#app#Notification#CATEGORY_CALL_E@ or @B_android#app#Notification#CATEGORY_MESSAGE_E@. The addition of people may also cause this notification to appear more prominently in the user interface. The person should be specified by the String representation of a @B_android#provider#ContactsContract#Contacts#CONTENT_LOOKUP_URI_E@. The system will also attempt to resolve mailto: and tel: schema URIs. The path part of these URIs must exist in the contacts database, in the appropriate column, or the reference will be discarded as invalid. Telephone schema URIs will be resolved by @B_android#provider#ContactsContract#PhoneLookup_E@. It is also possible to provide a URI with the schema name: in order to uniquely identify a person without an entry in the contacts database.

Returns: This value will never be null.
addAction(android.app.Notification.Actio.Description: Add an action to this notification. Actions are typically displayed by the system as a button adjacent to the notification content. Every action must have an icon (32dp square and matching the @B_android#app#PendingIntent_E@. A notification in its expanded form can display up to 3 actions, from left to right in the order they were added. Actions will not be displayed when the notification is collapsed, however, so be sure that any essential functions may be accessed by the user in some other way (for example, in the Activity pointed to by @B_android#app#Notification#contentIntent_E@).

setSubText(java.lang.CharSequence).Description: This provides some additional information that is displayed in the notification. No guarantees are given where exactly it is displayed. This information should only be provided if it provides an essential benefit to the understanding of the notification. The more text you provide the less readable it becomes. For example, an email client should only provide the account name here if more than one email account has been added. As of @B_android#os#Build#VERSION_CODES#N_E@ this information is displayed in the notification header area. On Android versions before @B_android#os#Build#VERSION_CODES#N_E@ this will be shown in the third line of text in the platform notification template. You should not be using @B_android#app#Notification#Builder#setProgress_E@ at the same time on those versions; they occupy the same place.

setOngoing(boolean).Description: Set whether this is an "ongoing" notification. Ongoing notifications cannot be dismissed by the user, so your application or service must take care of canceling them. They are typically used to indicate a background task that the user is actively engaged with (e.g., playing music) or is pending in some way and therefore occupying the device (e.g., a file download, sync operation, active network connection).

setSortKey(java.lang.String).Description: Set a sort key that orders this notification among other notifications from the same package. This sort key can also be used to order members of a notification group. See @B_android#app#Notification#Builder#setGroup_E@.

When set, the color set with @B_android#app#Notification#Builder#setColor_E@ will be used as the background color of this notification. This should only be used for high priority ongoing tasks like navigation, an ongoing call, or other similarly high-priority events for the user. For most styles, the coloring will only be applied if the notification is for a foreground service notification. However, for @B_android#app#Notification#MediaStyle_E@ and @B_android#app#Notification#DecoratedMediaCustomViewStyle_E@ notifications that have a media session attached there is no such requirement.

ClassDesc: Builder class for @B_android#app#Notification_E@ objects. Provides a convenient way to set the various fields of a @B_android#app#Notification_E@ and generate content views using the platform's notification layout template. If your app supports versions of Android as old as API level 4, you can instead use https:##developer#android#com@B_android#support#v4#app#NotificationCompat#Builder_E@, available in the Example:
